content.p: Follow Maian, a product design and manufacture student, as she takes you through her typical day to give you a taste of what to expect studying with us. Choosing both a course and a university where you can follow your passions and develop your career is a huge decision. We’re making sure that you have as much information as possible to help you make the best choice. Follow Maian, a product design and manufacture (PDM) student, as she takes you through her typical day to give you a taste of what to expect studying with us. She’ll take you to her design studio session, visiting George Green Library and even grab food with friends. Maian Torky shows you what a day in the life is like for a PDM student at the University of Nottingham. I want to be a part of the innovation of using new technology to further the designs of products that will help people to heal, live and learn. Therefore, studying Product Design and Manufacture was a great way of combining my creativity with engineering and applying it to real world applications in ways that look attractive and exciting.” Cat Rogers MEng Product Design and Manufacture student If you’re looking for more information, please head to our help and support hub, where you can find frequently asked questions or details of how to make an enquiry.
